oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Photograph of a nurse and patient in hospital
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: A nurse stands next to a bed where a male patient is weaving. Reverse of photo: “Mrs. Huntington – and one of the boys weaving a scarf – .“

In her 1920 passport application, Margaret Croft was living at 44 East 76th Street, New York City, and listed her occupation as "Red Cross Worker." These photographs appear to be taken during her time working for the Red Cross during that year.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Hospitals--New York (State)--New York; Medical personnel; Nurse and patient; Patients
Nurses; Health care personnel; American Red Cross
